items.content:
Account Executive

We are looking for an Account Executive to become an integral part of our expanding start-up business, Property Basecamp.

Property Basecamp began with a simple idea. An idea cultivated by a group of young professionals, a laptop and the desire to create something special. Now it has been defined as a platform that has the potential to disrupt the global employee relocation and property industry, and we want you to join us as we continue our expansion into the UK market.

So what actually is Property Basecamp? Property Basecamp is an enterprise digital application that connects a globally mobile workforce to their home away from home. However, Property Basecamp is about much more than just putting a roof overhead. Our one of a kind PB community platform will enhance your overall living experience by providing you with the ability to foster relationships and build a strong support network, not just with your housemates, neighbours, or people in your city but all over the world. So no matter where you go you will have a friendly face to help you settle in to your new surroundings.

PURPOSE OF THE ROLE
Have you ever had to relocate somewhere else in the world for work purposes? Well you know stressful this can be. Why not help reinvent the relocation experience! We are currently seeking candidates who would be interested in helping transferees relocate to London and the surrounding area. The Account executive responsibilities are:

• Work with account managers to build, manage, and grow strategic partnerships with large customers and agencies in the UK market
• Be the main point of contact on client accounts and ensure that our work is aligned with their business goals
• Leverage customer feedback to drive improvements to the products and services that we provide customers.
• Conduct Pre-Arrival consultation with relocating employee. Gather employee specific home search criteria.
• Educate and offer local knowledge and advice to relocating employees on all things London including, but not limited to: neighbourhoods, transportation links, commuting times, local amenities, schools, shopping, recreation and local dining
• Research suitable apartments/rental homes that meet the relocating employees individual and unique needs
• Assist with scheduling property viewings with property agencies and landlords
• Facilitate ‘individual mover’ employees to source potential housemates via PB ‘Buddy-Up’ process
• Full exposure to other departments within the company including Sales, Marketing and Product Development and management
• Strong potential for senior position as we are growing aggressively


This is not an ordinary role in an ordinary company. This is full-on startup mode where you will have the ability and freedom to make decisions in a split second without the need for approval after approval from management. We are extremely ambitious and plan to make ourselves a global brand which will provide you with the opportunity to see the world and grow both personally and professionally. What are you waiting for, take the leap

Underlying Principles when working with Property Basecamp
• Accountability - Are you happy to stand over the work you are doing?
• Provide Value- Provide more value to your colleagues, employees and stakeholders than you ask for
• Communication - transparency with your colleagues and stakeholders
• Respect - respect to your colleagues and stakeholders
• Property Basecamp is about People, not Properties

Property experience is a bonus for this role but not mandatory.

  • International Benefit Stipend - If you’re based outside the US, you’ll receive a monthly stipend that goes towards covering medical insurance, long and short-term disability, and accountant costs.

Since launching in April of 2011, Help Scout now powers 8,000+ support teams in over 140 countries. Our software is used and trusted by businesses of every shape and size.

We take work/life harmony seriously, too, as we want every career at Help Scout to be a long and satisfying one.

Diversity & Inclusion

Through our various media and live event efforts, we aim to serve our highly-engaged community members with professional, high-quality, and practical content.

As the Lean Startup movement grows, there is an increasing need to connect those who want to learn with those who want to help them move towards working the Startup Way. And Lean Startup Co. is the answer.

ABOUT THE POSITION

As the home base for the Lean Startup movement, we have a hearty community of enthusiastic followers. So we don’t need a Director of Business Development who preaches best practices. We are seeking a tenacious and metrics-driven Director of Business Development who has a proven track record of mastering product knowledge, building meaningful client relationships, closing large deals with enterprise companies and championing new ways of supporting our customers.

Come join us if you’re ready to help us help our customers solve the world’s biggest problems.
You’ll thrive in this role if you have experience delivering results in these four areas of core competency:

  1. You have a natural sales ability and the experience to back it up. You’ve helped develop and lead company Business Development/Sales strategy to drive sales and revenue growth.
  2. You’ve been the top Business Development/Sales performer at 1+ companies and have a track record of successful outcomes using data-driven decision-making.

    • You are an excellent listener. You create meaningful relationships with customers and believe in matching their needs with the services that will solve their unique problems.

    • You’re proud to represent, and intimately know, all facets of the products you’ve sold. You can clearly communicate the value of the last few products you sold (and how it is a validated solution for your customer’s problems!).
  • You’re in it not to just hit sales goals, but to help us achieve company goals and make a bigger impact in our community.

From accountants to startup incubators, universities to innovation consultants, the range of partnerships we have at GrantTree is vast. Our useful funding products, which we believe will change the landscape of Government funding allows us to network with people at the forefront of software technology in the UK. We're excited to start our hunt for the talent who will grow and maintain our network of satisfied partners.

Are you the self-motivated, entrepreneurial Partnerships Manager we're looking for?

GrantTree was founded 7 years ago and employs 33 people. In our self-managing culture everyone has the freedom, power and trust to do great work. We call this open culture. It’s been successful for us so far, a rewarding and somewhat unusual working experience for self-motivated individuals (we suggest you check out our GlassDoor reviews). This is the ideal environment for creative, independent people who are open to developing through challenging work.

Our Sales team is...

High-reaching.
Brilliant at conversion.
Formed of talented individuals each with their own creative way of building effective relationships.

Could you see yourself in this team?

A significant amount of GrantTree's success is a direct result from collaboration with our partners. We work with fantastic organisations and it's important to us to continue to strengthen our relationships with each of our existing and newly on-boarded partners.

You will work closely with the Partnership Director as a member of the wider Sales team to implement new partnership plans and to grow the deal flow from our existing Partnership base. Drawing on your prior Business Development experience you'll capitalise on your expert relationship building techniques to thrive within the Partnership space.

REQUIREMENTS

- You have professional experience in independent lead generation (within software/tech would be a plus).
- You're confident negotiating contracts and closing new business where necessary.
- You know how to generate and manage pipelines.
- You have the ability to implement partnership delivery plans.
- You enjoy working towards targets.
- Running workshops, roundtables, existing delivery plans and attending events are key activities for you.
- You're innovative, and think creatively about how to add further value to partnerships.
- You pride yourself on your brilliant communications skills.

BENEFITS

We believe that people should be rewarded fairly for the work they do. At GrantTree there is no secrecy over salaries and the way we work them out. For this role, this is likely to lie between £28k-£35k depending on experience. We don't have a commission structure here, and ask you to consider, "is important to you?"

While we understand an environment without commission won't work for everyone, if you join our team at GrantTree you can enjoy the unlimited access to paid training we offer, access to health insurance, our cycle to work scheme, and an annual discretionary bonus which all contribute to the overall package.

Aside from money, we offer a place where you can be yourself. We want you to develop your skills and fulfil your potential. We have a flexible approach to working, and some of our staff work remotely most of the time. Our office near Old Street is bright and airy, with a fab roof terrace. You can take up to 6 weeks as holiday each year.

Teams are stronger when they have a diverse range of people. Applications are accepted from everyone, regardless of the categories they put themselves in. We also encourage talented ‘square pegs’, who don’t neatly fit into the person specification, to apply.

How to Apply

Please use the email address provided and let us know you saw this job on "Work in Startups".

Account Executive (East Region)
McCormick - Work at Home

McCormick & Co., Inc., a world leader in the spice, flavor & seasonings industry, is seeking a full time Retail Account Executive – Northeast & Mid-Atlantic Region. This new hire will work for Gourmet Garden (gourmetgarden.com), a leading brand in the fresh produce department, calling on Ahold, Delhaize, Wegmans, Wakefern, Safeway Eastern, Market Basket and other independent retailers. The Account Executive will report to the Head of Sales for Gourmet Garden North America.

With more than $4 billion in annual sales, the Company manufactures markets and distributes spices, seasoning mixes, condiments and other flavorful products to the entire food industry – retail outlets, food manufacturers and foodservice businesses. We create differentiating flavors consumers prefer with unmatched quality, science, innovation and service. Every day, no matter where or what you eat, you can enjoy food flavored by McCormick. McCormick makes every moment and meal better™

As a company recognized for exceptional commitment to employees, McCormick offers a wide variety of benefits, programs and services. Benefits include, but are not limited to, tuition assistance, medical, dental, vision, disability, group life insurance, 401(k), profit sharing, paid holidays and vacations.

POSITION OVERVIEW

This Retail Account Executive is responsible for the achievement of customer volume objectives, budgets and planning. Execution of Retail controllables and customer collaboration are key responsibilities to the success of this position.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Developing and delivering customer plans to achieve volume objectives and primary and day-to-day selling interface at customer HQ.
Manage direct and indirect account sales of Gourmet Garden product offerings, category performance reviews, forecast & distribution for existing brands and new products.
Manage a team of dedicated part-time merchandisers exclusively representing the Gourmet Garden brand at store-level.
Partner with our produce broker network to execute business plans and optimize retail execution.
Represents the brand at selected regional and national produce trade shows.

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Marketing, Management or related field.
Minimum 4 years Sales, Marketing or related experience with a minimum of 2 years’ experience successfully managing customer base.
Proficient in the Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, Office365.
Excellent verbal and written communication, negotiating and influencing, teamwork and relationship, computer and analytical skills.
Ability to analyze, interpret and leverage syndicated and internal sales data.
Understanding of the Produce/CPG industry sector and competitive landscape required.
Ability to travel, approximately 25% of the time.
Valid Driver License and clean driving record.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

Strong relationships within retail and wholesale fresh produce channels in the assigned region.
Experience in channels/segments outside of traditional grocery (i.e., Natural, E-Commerce, etc.).
Entrepreneurial approach as portion of customer portfolio will be targeting undersold or unsold accounts.

McCormick & Company is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.

McCormick does not offer employment visa sponsorships upon hire or in the future. You must be lawfully authorized to commence work upon being offered employment.
